title: Alex Zhong
text:
Hello!
Welcome to my website, and thanks for stopping by!
I am a 1st year ScM student studying Biostatistics at Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health.
My research interests include causal inference, clinical trials, and environmental/spatial statistics, though I am interested in exploring new areas in biostatistics.
To learn more about me, explore the About page. For an out of this world analysis, check out the Example analysis page.

title: Example Analysis: UFO Sightings
text: FigureÂ 1: James Quigg/The Daily Press, via Associated Press and The Denver Post (Dec 22, 2017)

title: Example Analysis: UFO Sightings
text:
Motivation and questions
In a 2021 article, the New York Times reported an increase in UFO sightings over the pandemic, especially in New York state. Several possible causes were identified, including more time spent home, lower light pollution, and urban residents moving to rural areas, especially during the start of the pandemic in early 2020.
I found this intriguing, and wanted to replicate these findings with more recent data to see whether UFO sightings continue to be elevated. I also wanted to explore whether increased UFO sightings were reported across the United States (or were a localized New York event).
My questions for this analysis are:

Have UFO sightings increased in 2020-2021, and has the increase continued into later years?
How is the change in UFO sightings spatially distributed?

title: Example Analysis: UFO Sightings
text:
Intended audience
The intended audience is the general public, especially UFO enthusiasts.






Note



This is an assignment for my statistical computing course. I am not a subject matter expert, and this is not a serious analysis.
However, if the Pentagon is reading this and you are hiring: I am open for work.

title: Example Analysis: UFO Sightings
text:
Data source and dictionary
The datasets used in this analysis come from the 06/20/2023 Tidy Tuesday GitHub repository. Original data comes from the National UFO Reporting Center.
I will be using the ufo_sightings and places datasets, whose data dictionaries can be found here.
